classic fps , would suggest playing Counter-Strike, Counter-Strike: Condition Zero, before getting on Counter-Strike: Source if possible. it will help with overall gameplay to learn from the orignals. Counter-Strike: Source is my all time favorite, its hands down one of the best fps games ever made. Grew up playing Source, and as I got older i tried out Counter-Strike and Counter-Strike: Condition Zero, and it helped my gameplay for Source before the transition to Counter-Strike: Global Offensive.
its very good and still many maps, should buy.

While it is flawed, CS:S will always have a special place in  my heart. The community is what makes the game worth it, with things like minigames and surf servers. If you want to play competitive CS, then GO is the way to go (ayyy), but if there's some money burning a hole in your wallet and you wish to try proper bunny-hopping, by all means try CS:S.

По сути это тот же движок что и Counter-Strike: GO 
В данной игра а именно Counter-Strike: Source Можно понять систему игры 
так же подучится стрельбе теппингу и тд 
Можно сказать что CS:S это тренеровочный полигон на движке Source
Still one of my all time favorites games

I played CS:S a lot and enjoyed it for years. A solid shooter with the typical CS setting, but in all aspects outdated after the release of CS:GO. I must admit, I have never even missed it since. Therefore, I recommend to choose CS:GO over CS:S, as it is the better Counter-Strike after all. Thanks for all the good times and farewell.

tl;dr:

The game itself is fun to play, but go for CS:GO if you have to choose a CS to start with.

Godly game, probably has better hit reg than counter strike global but without the skins..

Counterstrike Source!

A classic, it may look like shit these days but this is still one of the best online FPS there is. Takes a while to get use to but once you do its really enjoyable.

Gameplay is simple but fun

Only thing I would warn is that seeing as Counter Strike global offensive is the current game in the series this game is badly neglected with updates aswell as there being no offiical servers. 

Also I would be lieing if i did not mention the amount of people cheating, it is a real problem but i suppose that is currently the issue for all online games. 

Its a real shame especially how fun this game can be but the amount of people you come across using all types of hacks is insane. Trigger-bot, Wallhack, aimlock, aimbot even silly disconnect macro's.

I have played other games online  and as you know it will happen time to time but how often it is on this game is astounding. Just constant cheating with aimlocks and wallhacks, blatant on eu servers especially  those hosting 24/7 dust2

Great game if you can find the right servers with active and "clued up" admins 

Update: Yeah this game is full to the brim of some of the most blatant cheaters, even a server (Which i wont name) where the admins can't stand a challenge and turn their hacks on. Honesty i do not see the purpose of playing this anymore, it is fun but my god the cheating on here is embarrassing.

7/10
About 50 headsets went into this game.

[h1] Un Counter Strike diferente [/h1]
 Counter Strike Source fue un juego graficamemte adelantado de su tiempo, cosa que supuso una bendicion y tambien una maldicion, ya que por una parte envejecio relativamente bien pero por el otro lado hizo que en el momemto de lanzamiento mucha gente no estuvo dispuesta a comprar una nueva computadora solo para jugar este titulo, lo que hizo uno de los juegos mas impopulares de la saga.
Hoy en día es un juego que recomemdaria si estas cansado de Csgo y quieres probar algo similar pero de otra epoca con otro enfoque. Si vienes de csgo se te sera relativamente mas facil acostumbrarte a alguien que venga de cs 1.6 por ejemplo debido a que a ellos se les sera un poco mas complejo adaptarse a los graficos y a la configuracion de las armas. Pero al final de cuentas es un juego que recomiendo para todo fan de los fps por lo bien que ha envejecido, por su calidad y por la fiel comunidad aun activa.
На первое время сойдет...ой, уже 3к часов ))00

A game released in Nov 1st, 2004; Counter-Strike: Source stands the test of time as a kind of.. Black sheep of the franchise. 

People play 1.6 for either Nostalgia, or because of mechanics they think are better.

People play Global Offensive for skins, slower paced gameplay, among other things.

Source stands there as a middle ground between them, it doesn't have the best shooting mechanics, it doesn't have the best shooting, and it certainly doesn't have the slowest pace, with bhopping being easy as it is in source. What keeps CSS alive now, are the community's gamemodes it has founded itself on. 

Bhop, as mentioned earlier, jailbreak, etc. 

That is what keeps a game alive for so long.

The $20 pricetag at retail is somehow more pricey than CS:GO, so, I'd say to wait for a sale... like now! 
(as of writing this; 26/11/17) 

In conclusion; get the game if you're a fan of Counter-Strike, or you want a game to mess around and have fun with your friends.
